initial_story:
You are certainly no friend of mine. You have accused me of lying about what you had said, and run away when I proved by actual quotation that the accusation was false. We both know that, even though you praise humility, you are not humble enough to apologize.

 You sneered at my combat experience, saying "A lot of so called "combat veterans" of Vietnam smelled more perfume from call girls than they smelled cordite" and "So when you were an Army officer in Vietnam (even though you spent your time inside of Danang airbase, with at least two battalions of infantry marines on the wire ) what was the combat load for M-16 ammo per soldier on a daily patrol?" An actual friend would not have written such things.

No, you are no friend of mine, you ignorant, arrogant, hypocritical blow-hard. You should be able to guess that I do not feel friendly towards you
stories:
I never thought highly of you. Instead of acknowledging the truth, you chose to deflect by accusing me of dishonesty, only to flee once I supported my claim with concrete evidence. Your lack of humility is palpable, and you consistently miss the mark when it comes to showing sincerity and respect. Your earlier jabs about my military experience, which included "a lot of self-proclaimed 'combat veterans' [who] smelled more perfume from call girls than they smelled gunpowder" and "what was the daily ammunition load for an M-16 patrol from an Army officer like yourself, who spent most of their time in Danang airbase, accompanied by two battalions of infantry?" - such words from someone who would never dare to utter such hurtful comments to a friend in a respectful tone are insulting.

And it's clear to me that, as you are none of the above traits - ignorant, arrogant, and hypocritical - you have no idea how unlikable you appear to others when you speak and write. It's no wonder I wouldn't consider you a trustworthy or dependable ally.

I've never held you in high esteem. Your failure to confront reality was evident when you turned the conversation around, making false accusations of dishonesty before quickly distancing yourself when I substantiated my claims with facts. Your humble demeanor is lacking, and you consistently misjudge the fine line between sincerity and respect. I'm disheartened by your earlier belittling comments about my military experience, particularly your comparison of self-proclaimed veterans to call girls and your question about an M-16 patrol daily ammunition load - harsh remarks that only a stranger would dare utter. Moreover, as someone who fails to exhibit genuine traits - lacking knowledge, prideful, and two-faced - it's no surprise that I view you as unlikable when interacting with others. It's unsurprising that I wouldn't consider you a trustworthy or dependable ally.

I've always questioned your credibility. When I presented logical proof to support my statements, you changed the subject and launched unfounded accusations against me instead of addressing the issue at hand. Your supposed humility feels pretentious, and you struggle to comprehend the subtleties between honesty and respect. Your earlier remarks diminished my military background, comparing veterans to prostitutes and trivializing their experiences. More specifically, only a bystander would utter such insults as questioning daily ammunition loads for an M-16 patrol. Your lack of sincerity, pride, and authentic character is glaring, making me wary of your reputation among others and questioning your trustworthiness as an ally.

I've repeatedly wondered about your credibility. When I backed up my claims with solid evidence, you avoided addressing the core issue by making unjust accusations and shifting the focus away from the problem at hand. I find your supposed humility to be disingenuous, and you often struggle to differentiate between honesty and respect. Moreover, only an outsider might display that type of disrespect by belittling a veteran's background and minimizing their experience, as shown in your earlier remarks. Your comment about questioning a patrol unit's daily ammunition quantity in an M-16 is characteristic of such callousness. Given your insincere demeanor, arrogant attitude, and incomplete character, I have reservations about your reputation among others and doubt your trustworthiness as an ally.

I've repeatedly questioned the authenticity of your statements. Despite presenting evidence to validate my claims, you changed the topic and made baseless accusations, which suggests you're unwilling to confront the heart of the matter. Your so-called humility appears insincere, as you struggle to distinguish between truthful and respectful communication. Furthermore, only someone outside the group may exhibit disrespect by discounting a veteran's background and downplaying their experience, as you did in an earlier message. Your comment about questioning the daily M-16 ammunition count of a patrol unit exemplifies this insensitivity. Given your fake front, self-importance, and immature character, I have doubts about your reputation among others and wonder if you're a reliable partner.

I have consistently raised questions about the credibility of your assertions. Although I provided evidence to support my points, you dodged the topic and hurled unnecessary insults, indicating your reluctance to tackle the core issue. Your claim of modesty strikes me as superficial, as it seems you struggle to discern between genuine and respectful interaction. Moreover, only someone lacking internal influence could disrespect the accomplishments of those familiar by undervaluing a veteran's credentials, such as you've done. Your recent statement about questioning a patrol unit's M-16 ammunition count daily illustrates this insensitivity. Given your façade, self-importance, and childish behavior, I'm skeptical about how others perceive you and question whether you're a dependable ally.

I have repeatedly queried the veracity of your statements, presenting proof to bolster my claims. However, instead of addressing the issue, you avoided the topic and counterattack with offensive barbs, suggesting reluctance to engage with the core matter. Your professed humility seems incongruous, as it appears you find it challenging to differentiate between constructive and respectful communication. Furthermore, only someone unmoved by internal compass could disregard the achievements of those around them, such as minimizing a seasoned individual's track record. Your recent statement, wherein you voiced concern about questioning a patrol unit's daily M-16 ammo count, serves as further evidence of this callous disregard. Given your grandiose exterior, air of self-importance, and erratic behavior, I remain uncertain about how others perceive you and question whether you can be relied upon as a dependable ally.

I have consistently questioned the accuracy of your claims, providing evidence to support my arguments. Instead of addressing the concerns, you disregarded them and responded with aggressive comments, indicating a reluctance to tackle the central issue. Your claims of humility seem inconsistent given your difficulty distinguishing between respectful and constructive dialogue. Additionally, only someone insensitive to those around them could overlook accomplishments and accomplishments of colleagues, such as diminishing the experience of a dedicated individual. Your recent statement, in which you expressed worry about questioning a patrol unit's daily ammunition count, further illustrates this uncaring attitude. Given your pompous demeanor, self-assured posturing, and unpredictable behavior, I remain unclear about how others view you and have doubts about your ability to be a dependable ally.
